text: I guess maybe the problem is what's <https://fredrikekre.se/posts/highlight-julia/|described here> - my code all looks like the "before" stuff. Sorry for the noise

attachments.title: Improved syntax highlighting for Julia on the web | Fredrik Ekre
attachments.text: A greatly improved syntax highlighter for the Julia programming language in highlight.js.
attachments.fallback: Improved syntax highlighting for Julia on the web | Fredrik Ekre

elements.text: I guess maybe the problem is what's
- my code all looks like the "before" stuff. Sorry for the noise

text: the `hascode` can be removed but that's irrelevant, what you should check is what highlight library you're serving. By default Franklin either tries to pre-render all your code using the highlightjs module or it tries to serve the static library. What you could do is use a CDN link instead (see <https://highlightjs.org/download/>) then you'll get the latest release and improvements to the julia highlighting
